summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding proposed redactions to sealed documents in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The parties agree on no redactions to the court's opinion on suppression motions and coordinate filing a joint letter to the court.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating with prosecutors on redaction proposals.

persons.name: Lara Pomerantz
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the Maxwell case, leading communication about redactions.

persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney copied on correspondence about case procedures.

connections.description: Everdell is part of Maxwell's defense team, representing her in the criminal case.
Menninger is part of Maxwell's defense team, copied on all case correspondence.
Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team, included in case communications.
Sternheim is part of Maxwell's defense team, receiving case updates.
Prosecutor and defense attorney coordinating on procedural matters regarding redactions.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issuing orders.

events.title: Court Order on Unsealing Documents
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order regarding unsealing documents in the Maxwell case, including the opinion on suppression motions.

events.title: Deadline for Redaction Proposals
events.description: Deadline for parties to propose redactions to the court's opinion on Maxwell's motions to suppress evidence.

events.title: Deadline for Other Document Redactions
events.description: Deadline for parties to propose redactions to other documents ordered unsealed.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell proposed no redactions to the court's opinion on suppression motions.
Judge Alison Nathan ordered the unsealing of documents including the opinion on Maxwell's motions to suppress evidence.
The parties were required to file joint letters by specific deadlines indicating whether they sought redactions.
This document shows coordination between prosecution and defense on procedural matters in the Maxwell case.
The email chain reveals the extensive legal teams involved on both sides of the case.
